attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Binyam Mohamed illegally in the uk

 The Conservative Party says that Binyam Mohamed, the former Guantánamo Bay detainee, should be considered for deportation

David Lidington, the shadow foreign minister, said there was a "serious question" over whether Mr Mohamed, 30, should be allowed to remain in Britain indefinitely. 


Under current rules, asylum seekers would not be allowed to come to Britain after spending a period in a third country.

Mr Mohamed is illegally in the uk & i petition he is deported & that the government follows the law on deportation of illegal immigrants who left the uk to a 3rd country pakistan & afganistan & under british law he has no right to stay in the uk anymore.

I have the right as a british citizen to demand the government follow UK immigration laws.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
